ijp.controller

Interface Controller

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WorldController

    public interface Controller
    A controller for the HomeViewer application.
    Author:
    Konstantinos Zacharis (s1569729@sms.ed.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkItemsPosition()
      Show or hide items depending on their position.
      void exit()
      Exit platform.
      void goForward(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      goForward is triggered when the top arrow is pressed.
      void initializeImages()
      Set buttons background transparent and set images.
      void moveWithButtons()
      moveWithButtons is used to rotate or go forward with buttons (A,W,D), while clicking the arrows on the screen.
      void rotateLeft(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      rotateLeft is used to show the left image of the image shown when pressing the left button.
      void rotateRight(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      rotateRight is used to bring the right image when pressing the right button.
      void topArrowVisibility()
      Set buttons visible or invisible, depending the location.

    • Method Detail

      • moveWithButtons

        void moveWithButtons()
        moveWithButtons is used to rotate or go forward with buttons (A,W,D), while clicking the arrows on the screen.

      • goForward

        void goForward(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        goForward is triggered when the top arrow is pressed. It is used to change room depending the location, when pressed.
        Parameters:
        event - The event is used to represent the action.

      • topArrowVisibility

        void topArrowVisibility()
        Set buttons visible or invisible, depending the location.

      • rotateLeft

        void rotateLeft(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        rotateLeft is used to show the left image of the image shown when pressing the left button. It also keeps track, whether the items should be shown or not.
        Parameters:
        event - The event is used to represent the action.

      • rotateRight

        void rotateRight(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        rotateRight is used to bring the right image when pressing the right button. It also keeps track, whether the items should be shown or not.
        Parameters:
        event - The event is used to represent the action.

      • initializeImages

        void initializeImages()
        Set buttons background transparent and set images.

      • exit

        void exit()
        Exit platform.

      • checkItemsPosition

        void checkItemsPosition()
        Show or hide items depending on their position.
